conclusion: To find the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases, analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph.
Identify the acceleration and deceleration phases for Particle A and B from the graph.
Particle A: Acceleration Phase from 0 to t0, Deceleration Phase from t0 to 3t0.
Particle B: Acceleration Phase from 0 to 5t0, Deceleration Phase from 5t0 to 6t0.
Acceleration is the slope of the velocity-time graph.
For Particle A: Calculate acceleration as (2v0 - 0) / t0 = 2v0 / t0.
For Particle B: Calculate acceleration as (v0 - 0) / 5t0 = v0 / 5t0.
Calculate the ratio of magnitudes of acceleration: (2v0 / t0) / (v0 / 5t0) = 10.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases is 10:1.
